definition[0]: if you reconcile two ideas, situations, or facts, you find a way in which they can both be true or acceptable
example[0]: The possibility remains that the two theories may be reconciled.
example[1]: Bevan tried to reconcile British socialism with a wider international vision.
definition[1]: to make two accounts or statements agree or add up to the same total
example[2]: This hurried attempt to reconcile the books was a mistake.
